column4: vit, if you can't find it then who's gonna hold your hand afterwards
afterwards?
, you click on "Get Ubuntu " as oCean says
oCean gave me the URL I was looking for.  I just couldn't (and still can't) find it anywhere on ubuntu.com. Even after clicking "Get Ubuntu". What did I miss?
http://www.ubuntu.com/download
Ok ... and then?
make your choice and click on it
I wantes a live CD so I chose the middle one: "Try it from a CD ...". Then what's next? Where's the URL?
is there something wrond with your browser ?  http://www.ubuntu.com/download/ubuntu/download , click on "start download"
That won't give an URL, would it?
(The browser is Firefox on Ubuntu, btw.)
you're on irssi , why ? you can't download with that
I didn't understand your last question. How's irssi related to me being not able to find the download URLs anywhere on ubunti.com?
I need Chrome and the 11.3 Flash that is built-in.
then you'll be stuck with using chrome exclusively , if you want to use websites with flash content
I only want to use one website with flash.

I didn’t use Flash before and I’m pretty sure I won’t. But I need it to run on that one website and there I need 11.3 which should ship with Google Chrome. I just son’t know how to activate it. It’s not listed under about:plugins.

most websites use flash content , I suggest you install flashplayer from adobe rather than the repos , extract it and then place libflashplayer.so in /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins , because chrome browsers look in that file for the flashplayer
Adobe has no 11.3 for linux. Their latest is 11.3
There are problems especially with that one website I need to use Flash on. They know about the problem with 11.2 and write about it on their site. Maybe over 9,000 users are affected.
i see, do windows users encounter problems there as well ?
I think no, because they can have newer Flash versions from Adobe.
